intro: Echites edulis, commonly known as the edible echites, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its erect, branching stems and clusters of small, white or yellowish flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite and ovate, with a slightly hairy texture. While the plant is not widely cultivated, it has been used traditionally for its medicinal and edible properties.
